results.headline: A Movie Legend’s Long Run
results.summary_short: In “Magician: The Astonishing Life and Work of Orson Welles,” the director Chuck Workman examines that ambitious filmmaker.

results.headline: Don’t Say That Word (It Might Come True)

results.headline: Telling Lies for Love, Cruelty or Expediency
results.summary_short: A restored version of Mario Monicelli’s 1960 film, “The Passionate Thief,” is having its first New York theatrical run at Film Forum.

results.headline: In the Samurai Business, We Used to Do Our Own Stunts
results.summary_short: “Uzumasa Limelight,” directed by Ken Ochiai, tells the story of one of the “kirareyaku,” old-school samurai actors, at the end of his career.

results.headline: No Midnight Cowgirl
results.summary_short: A lesbian prostitute and her heterosexual mentor in sex work experience comic adventures around New York in “The Foxy Merkins,” which has the tone of an absurdist buddy comedy.

results.headline: An Intercessor, Straddling Two Families
results.summary_short: Lily Yeh, whose work aims to heal communities, aims for more personal healing in the documentary “The Barefoot Artist.”

results.headline: Nursing Real Wounds, and Romantic Ones
results.summary_short: In the rom-com “Take Care,” a woman injured in a car accident and needing help managing her daily life calls on an old boyfriend.

results.headline: Arms Locked, and Awakening to Their Strength
results.summary_short: With interviews and historical footage, “She’s Beautiful When She’s Angry” surveys a heady period in the late ’60s when women organized to demand their rights.

results.summary_short: The Norwegian thriller “Pioneer” focuses on an oil exploration worker who develops deep suspicions about his employer.

results.headline: A Pet Dies, and the Fun Begins

results.headline: Class Warfare at the Most Intimate Level

results.headline: Reverberations of a Subjugated Past
results.summary_short: In “Concerning Violence,” Goran Hugo Olsson uses archival clips, texts by the scholar Frantz Fanon and voice-overs by musicians to revisit anticolonialist struggles of the 20th century.
